title: Get shutdown for 1000g, still have a 450g bounty before i even respawn.
body: What the fuck is this bounty system honestly? This is fucking trash.

replies.body:
In the previous system the enemy would have gotten 1450 instead it caps at 1000 and the rest is past on. 

How else can league have comeback mechanics?

> [{quoted}](name=mack9112,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uQIXlGKL,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-11-21T10:09:28.615+0000)
>
> In the previous system the enemy would have gotten 1450 instead it caps at 1000 and the rest is past on. 
> 
> How else can league have comeback mechanics?

no, they would have gotten 1150

Yeah I am at odds with this new bounty system, let alone the bounty system in general. It also punishes you for farming too despite the fact that you have to farm as a means to get ahead. Some of these changes really do worry me.
It doesn't punish you for farming. It punishes you for not playing safe and not considering the impact your death could have on the game.

No it does punish you for farming, not playing safe is something that it also punishes you for but Riot has outright said that farm adds to your own bounty. Just because one thing is true doesn't mean the other can't be. Two things can be true at once.

Farming gets you ahead, not behind. Dying gives gold to the enemy. If you just keep on farming without dying, you're not giving gold to the enemy so you're not punished for farming, just for dying. Adding gold to your bounty is not a punishment lol If it is then just stop playing and just try to get assists so that your bounty never goes up.

Do you consider Riot is punishing you for getting kills? I don't, same goes for CS.

How often do you normally have a perfect game without dying? If you use the assumption that you're going to die at least once after minions spawn it punishes you for farming. I'm not sure at how many CS that the bounty begins to kick in, but lets be practical everyone's going to die eventually in a match. There are the odd games that are a clear stomp and even then the people doing the stomping still die.

So yes in theory you are right, if you proceed to farm like a beast and never die the whole game then yeah the bounty system doesn't punish you. But realistically with damage being so high, I don't know how often you can consistently not die every match. 

Also, yes I do consider the bounty system as a form of punishment for getting kills, whether or not its a good mechanic or a bad mechanic is a different issue entirely. (Personally I think its fine but it does inherently punish the team with the kill streak.)

No I agree you'll more than likely die once or more during the game. 

That being said I think it's just normal that you become a valuable target if you've got more gold than the enemy team on average. 

You get +50 gold on your bounty if you got 250g coming from CS more than enemy's average income coming from CS. Then you get +50 for every 150g beyond that point. Note that it's only counting the income since your last death. 

It doesn't seem that big TBH and if you're the only lane ahead in terms of CS then you should be fine since the enemy team's average CS is likely pretty high/equivalent to yours. If your whole team is ahead then you should have at least vision control & objective control as well so it should still be easier to end the game.

I've played a few games yesterday and I think the amount of your bounty is almost only coming from killing the enemy champs or turrets.

Maybe I'm wrong but so far I haven't seen it become a big issue where a 0/5 player had like a 600g bounty (it must happen but it should be rare).

It is an issue when you are 2-0 with less, but still decent, CS.

They then get more bounty than you got with your two kills.
It means you had a 1450g bounty on you and it wasn't handed out to the other team in one go. It's good for you, goofster.
